item.title: Problem of class 38
item.description: For $$ f(z) = \frac{1}{(z - i)(z + i)} consider $f(z) = \frac{A}{z-i} + \frac{B}{z + i}$ and solve $A, B$ And it's $f(z) = \frac{-i/2}{z-i} + \frac{i/2}{z+i}$ ...

item.title: index
item.description: This note is outcome of fall 24 Math 444. Elementary Real Analysis in UIUC, taught by professor Marius Junge. The number after sub-heading indicates the number of class(e.g.

item.title: Power theory
item.description: Thm 37.1 For \sum a_kx^k = f(x) we can prove f'(x) = \sum k a_k x^{k -1} \int f(t) dt = \sum \frac{a_kx^{k+1}}{k+1} Thm 37.2 For uniform limit \lim f_n' = g where g is continue ...

item.title: differentiable
item.description: Def 31.3 F is differentiable at x if (\exists a)(\forall \varepsilon > 0)(\exists \delta)|x - y| < \delta \Longrightarrow |\frac{F(y) - F(x)}{y - x} - a| < \varepsilon where ...

item.title: integral
item.description: Def 29.3 \int^b_a f(x) dx = I = \lim_k \overline{\sum}_{\tau_k} f= \lim R(f, \xi) if f is integrable Prop 29.4 \forall \sigma \underline{\sum}_\sigma f \leq \int ^b_a f(x) dx \leq ...

item.title: integrable
item.description: Def 28.5 pg. 228 Darboux integrable For I = [a,b] and f:I \longrightarrow \mathbb{R} be a bounded function. Then f is Darboux integrable if (\exists \tau)(\forall \varepsilon > 0)\overline{\sum}_\tau f - \underline{\sum}_\tau f < \varepsilon Def 28.1 Riemann integrable (\exists I)(\forall \varepsilon > 0)(\exists \delta)(\exists \sigma)(\exists\xi) |\sigma| < \delta \Longrightarrow |R(f, \xi) - I| < \varepsilon where \sigma is a partition, \delta is the max mesh size, and \xi is a set with points from every sub-interval in \sigma, R is Riemann Sum.

item.title: mesh
item.description: Def pg. 200 The mesh (or norm) of partition is defined by || \mathcal{P} || = \max\{x_1 - x_0, x_2 - x_1, \dots, x_n - x_{n - 1}\} which is the largest length of all sub-interval.
